result.execSummary:
The defendant NICOLE ASHLEY HOOVER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Electric Weapon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.295(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
PAYABLE TO CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE - 30 days to pay or request a payment plan. 
Due September 12, 2022.
All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

Plus supervision fees. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Absolute sobriety.
No intoxicants.
Not to possess or consume any alcohol. 
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs. 
Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed. 
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Not to possess syringes unless medically required. 
No association with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
No possession of dangerous weapons including: firearms, knives not used for food items, or electric weapons.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.
